holidays.name: Geek Pride Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate all things geeky — from comics and science fiction to tech and gaming. Embrace your inner nerd and proudly show off your fandom!
holidays.origin: Started in 2006 in Spain to commemorate the birthday of Star Wars and the release of the first Star Wars movie.
holidays.funFact: The date (May 25) was chosen because it’s the original release date of Star Wars in 1977, a cultural cornerstone for geeks worldwide.

holidays.name: National Missing Children’s Day (U.S.)
holidays.description: A solemn day to honor missing and abducted children and to spread awareness about child safety and recovery efforts.
holidays.origin: Established in 1983 by President Ronald Reagan to mark the anniversary of the disappearance of Etan Patz, one of the first missing children widely publicized in the U.S.
holidays.funFact: Etan Patz’s case helped spark the modern kidnappings awareness movement, including the creation of the 'Amber Alert' system.

holidays.name: Towel Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the life and works of Douglas Adams, author of 'The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy,' by carrying a towel with you all day—because you never know when it might come in handy!
holidays.origin: Started in 2001 by fans two weeks after Adams’ death on May 11, as a tribute to a beloved sci-fi author.
holidays.funFact: In Adams’ book, a towel is described as "about the most massively useful thing an interstellar hitchhiker can have."

holidays.name: Brown-Bag It Day
holidays.description: Skip the fast food and bring your lunch from home to save money and eat healthier — plus maybe show off your creative sandwich skills!
holidays.origin: Promoted by health organizations and employees’ groups to encourage home-packed lunches and better nutrition.
holidays.funFact: Brown-bagging your lunch can reportedly save you over $1,300 a year!
